text: Idaṃ kho pana bhikkhave dukkhaṃ ariyasaccaṃ jātipi dukkhā jarāpi dukkhā byādhipi dukkho maraṇampi dukkhaṃ appiyehi sampayogo dukkho piyehi vippayogo dukkho yampicchaṃ na labhati tampi dukkhaṃ saṃkhittena pañcupādānakkhandhā dukkhā
edit: Idaṃ kho pana bhikkhave dukkhaṃ ariyasaccaṃ – jātipi dukkhā jarāpi dukkhā byādhipi dukkho maraṇampi dukkhaṃ appiyehi sampayogo dukkho piyehi vippayogo dukkho yampicchaṃ na labhati tampi dukkhaṃ – saṃkhittena pañcupādānakkhandhā dukkhā

translations.transtext: This, monks, [is] the noble truth [of] suffering. Birth [is] suffering, also decay, illness, [and] death. Association with unpleasant [things] [is] suffering, also separation with pleasant [things]. That [one] does not get what one wishes [is] also suffering. In short, the attached five aggregates [are] suffering.
